faqs.question: Ist die Costa Blanca ein guter Ort zum Immobilienkauf?
faqs.answer: Yes. Costa Blanca combines affordability, Mediterranean climate, established infrastructure, and consistent 8% year-on-year market growth. The region attracts international buyers for holiday homes and investment properties. Rental yields are strong (€800+ weekly for 2-bedroom properties), and the cost of living is significantly lower than Northern Europe or island markets. The established expat community ensures buyer support and English-language services.

faqs.question: Können Ausländer Immobilien in Spanien kaufen?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Spain welcomes foreign property purchases with no restrictions on nationality or residency status. The process requires a Spanish tax identification number (NIE), notary involvement, and property registry registration. Most international buyers work with local English-speaking solicitors handling documentation. The Spanish property market actively markets to foreign investors, with established processes streamlining purchases for non-residents.

faqs.question: Welche Kosten fallen beim Immobilienkauf in Spanien an?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, expect 6-10% in additional costs including notary fees (1%), property registry fees (0.5-1%), legal fees (1-2%), and property transfer tax (6-10% depending on region). Stamp duty, cadastral charges, and agency fees (if applicable) comprise the remainder. For this €120,000 property, budget €7,200-€12,000 in additional purchase costs. Consulting a Spanish solicitor provides exact figures for your transaction.

faqs.question: Wie hoch sind die Lebenshaltungskosten an der Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca offers significantly lower living costs than Northern Europe. Monthly expenses for a couple average €1,200-€1,800 including rent/mortgage, utilities, food, and entertainment. Grocery shopping at Mercadona and local markets is remarkably affordable. Restaurant meals cost €8-€15. Healthcare expenses are minimal with Spanish insurance (€80-€150 monthly) or affordable private options. This property's €120,000 price tag, combined with low living costs, creates compelling long-term value.

faqs.question: Ist die Costa Blanca gut für Rentner?
faqs.answer: Excellent. Costa Blanca attracts retirees for affordable living, excellent healthcare, guaranteed sunshine (320+ days annually), and established international communities. Spain offers favorable residency programs for retirees. Healthcare quality ranks among Europe's best with English-speaking doctors. The cost of living supports comfortable retirements on modest incomes. Social opportunities abound through expat clubs, beach activities, and cultural events. El Vergel specifically suits retirees seeking authentic Spanish living without tourist town atmosphere.

faqs.question: Wie weit ist die Costa Blanca von Deutschland entfernt?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca sits 1,400 km (870 miles) south of the UK, approximately 2.5 flying hours from most UK airports. Alicante-Elche Airport, 45 minutes from El Vergel, offers numerous daily direct flights to London, Manchester, and Birmingham. Budget airlines (Ryanair, Easyjet) provide affordable options under €50 each way. This accessibility makes Costa Blanca ideal for frequent UK visitors or those maintaining family connections.

faqs.question: Wie ist das Wetter an der Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys Mediterranean climate with 320+ days of annual sunshine, average temperatures of 18°C in winter and 28°C in summer. Rainfall is minimal (300-400mm annually), concentrated in autumn and spring. Coastal breezes keep summer temperatures comfortable. Winter rarely drops below 10°C, making it ideal for escaping northern European cold. This consistently pleasant weather supports year-round outdoor living, beach access, and the holiday home lifestyle.

faqs.question: Welche Mieteinnahmen kann ich von dieser Immobilie erwarten?
faqs.answer: Similar 2-bedroom properties in El Vergel command €800 per week during peak seasons (July-September). With conservative estimates of 13-20 weeks annual booking, expected annual rental income ranges €10,400-€16,000. Off-season rates (€400-€600 weekly) provide additional income September-June. Net after maintenance, cleaning, and management typically reaches 60-70% of gross. This yield means your €120,000 investment could generate €6,000-€11,000 annual net income while serving as your personal holiday retreat.

faqs.question: Brauche ich ein Visum, um Immobilien in Spanien zu kaufen?
faqs.answer: No visa is required specifically for property purchase. Non-EU citizens simply need a Spanish tax identification number (NIE) and follow standard property procedures. However, residency intentions may trigger visa requirements for extended stays. EU/UK citizens (post-Brexit) can stay 90 days visa-free, with longer stays requiring appropriate visas. Most property buyers consult Spanish solicitors regarding residency options. Purchasing property doesn't automatically grant residency but opens pathways to residency programs.
